pkgmetadata.longdescription: Optimal Selection of SNPs Using a Unified Local Function // Applies a unified local function to select SNPs for low-density SNPs. The method is described in Wu et al. (2020) doi:10.1111/age.12916. Briefly, the local function gives different weights to the uniformity (U score) and average Shannon entropy (E score), depending on the inputs of the weights, thus facilitating SNP designs under varied scenarios for low-density SNP chips, including selecting uniformly- distributed SNPs or SNPs with the highest minor allele frequencies. This is an educational version. For more information about this package, please contact Dr. Nick Wu.
